column4: Could someone please gimmie a hand? I'm trying to save some files from a dead windows box, and i can't mount the harddrive: it's telling me i need to boot into windows and run chkdsk, but obviously i can't. D:

Oh, sorry. I'm running an Ubuntu Live CD and trying to save the files on a dead windows box. The hard drive won't mount, and in the error details I am told to run chkdsk /f in windows, and reboot. I can't do that, though, because the windows install is dead.
Is that a bit clearer, bullgard4? :/
I only know that this software used to recoverd data from partitions. I dont know further. see if this helps: http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk
unfortunately because windows is dead i can't burn any CD's :/
